intro: Agretta stricta, commonly known as the slender agretta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Agretta stricta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands.
